title: SpaceX completes record year with Israeli imaging satellite launch
summary: SpaceX capped off the busiest year in its two-decade history Dec. 30 with a Falcon 9 launch of a commercial Israeli imaging satellite.

title: SpaceX ties 42-year-old Soviet record with last launch of 2022
summary: SpaceX has tied a 42-year-old record with its 61st and final Falcon rocket launch of 2022. Also marking the latest in a...

title: SpaceX launches EROS-C3 observation satellite from Vandenberg
summary: SpaceX has launched its 61st and final mission of 2022, this one aboard a Falcon 9 rocket. The EROS-C3 mission lifted off from Space Launch Complex 4 East (SLC-4E) at the Vandenberg Space Force Base (VSFB) in California on Thursday, Dec. 29 at 11:38 PM PST (07:38 UTC on Dec. 30).

title: Investing in Space: A year to forget for space stocks
summary: For most anyone with money in the market, 2022 was a year to forget – and space stocks were no exception. While the sector has continued to grow, many of the companies who took the fast SPAC way out ran into a wall this year.

title: Cubesat launched on Artemis 1 trying to fix propulsion system
summary: A cubesat launched on Artemis 1 missed its original chance to go into orbit around the moon but could still carry out its primary mission if engineers fix its thrusters in the coming weeks.

title: China sends second Shiyan-10 test satellite sent into orbit with its final launch of 2022
summary: China has conducted its 64th and final launch of the year, sending the Shiyan-10 (02) into orbit from Xichang spaceport.

title: ESA to hire more staff after budget increase
summary: Fresh off of securing a significant budget increase, the European Space Agency plans to hire 200 new employees in 2023 to help it implement new projects.

title: Russian space program facing challenges ahead of ambitious 2023
summary: In the new year, Russia plans to launch its first probe to the Moon since 1976, debut a new member of the Soyuz rocket family, and launch the new Soyuz GVK resupply spacecraft to the International Space Station (ISS).

title: Thales Alenia Space studying reusable spacecraft for in-orbit manufacturing
summary: Uncrewed rather than crewed spacecraft will be key to realizing an emerging in-orbit manufacturing industry, according to a European venture that has tasked Thales Alenia Space to develop a vehicle called REV1 for missions starting in late 2025.

title: NASA made sole-source award for space station spacesuit
summary: A task order Collins Aerospace received to develop a new spacesuit for the International Space Station was awarded on a sole-source basis, a move NASA says was intended to preserve competition for later phases of the program.
